Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a brown pottery vessel, the interior is slightly grooved and covered with a dark-brown resinous material, the exterior is covered with a dark-brown slip and remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink, faded and worn in parts, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.201)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36484) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36484)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 348 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
